snippet: The United States, officials from both countries say, took on too many projects and often did not consult with the Iraqis about which projects were needed and how best to go about them.
abstract: Government report details mistakes made by United States in improvement projects for Iraq and reflects views of officials from both countries that United States took on too many large projects and often did not consult with Iraqis about which projects were needed and how best to go about them; as result, Iraqis lacked ability to continue projects as American presence dwindled, and United States suffered loss of good will and leverage.
lead_paragraph: The United States, officials from both countries say, took on too many projects and often did not consult with the Iraqis about which projects were needed and how best to go about them.

headline.main: Report Details Mistakes Made by U.S. in Improvement Projects for Iraq
headline.print_headline: Report Details Mistakes Made by U.S. in Improvement Projects for Iraq

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
